quickGuide.title: Cinnamon Quick Guide
quickGuide.line1: Ceylon vs. Cassia: Ceylon = delicate, floral notes; Cassia = bold, sweet-spicy.
quickGuide.line3: Great pairings: apples, pumpkin, coffee, yogurt, oats, chocolate, lamb.
quickGuide.line4: Storage: airtight jar, cool & dark; best within 6–8 months for peak aroma.

storage.title: Proper storage
storage.text: Airtight jar, cool and dark place. For peak aroma: use within 6–8 months.

dosage.title: Dosage & safety
dosage.text: For home recipes: ½–1 tsp per serving. Prefer a delicate aroma? Choose Ceylon.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Ceylon vs. Cassia – which is better for desserts?
faq.a1: Ceylon offers fine, floral notes; Cassia is bolder, sweet-spicy.
faq.a2: Sticks for infusions/milk; ground for doughs and quick spice mixes.

rulouri-cu-scortisoara.title: Cinnamon Rolls
rulouri-cu-scortisoara.excerpt: Fluffy dough, generous cinnamon filling, and silky frosting. Perfect for breakfast or dessert.
ingredients: 60 g soft butter + 40 g melted (for filling)
Frosting: 120 g cream cheese, 40 g butter, 100 g powdered sugar, vanilla
steps: Mix milk, yeast and 1 tsp sugar; rest 5–10 min until foamy.
Knead flour with sugar, salt, egg, yeast mixture and 60 g soft butter. Proof 60–90 min.
Roll dough into a rectangle, brush with 40 g melted butter, sprinkle brown sugar + cinnamon.
Roll tightly, cut into 12 pieces, place in pan. Proof 30 min.
Bake at 180°C for 25–30 min. Make the frosting and spread over warm rolls.

granola-cu-scortisoara.title: Cinnamon & Nut Granola
granola-cu-scortisoara.excerpt: Crispy oats, toasted nuts, honey and cinnamon. Perfect with yogurt or milk.
steps: Combine oats, nuts, seeds, cinnamon and salt.
Mix oil with honey; pour over the dry mix and toss to coat.
Spread on a lined tray. Bake at 160–170°C for 22–28 min, stirring halfway.
Cool completely (it crisps up), then add dried fruit.

latte-cu-scortisoara.title: Cinnamon Latte
latte-cu-scortisoara.excerpt: Velvety espresso, steamed milk and a dusting of cinnamon for warm, cozy vibes.
steps: Sweeten the espresso to taste.
Heat and foam the milk.
Pour milk over espresso. Dust with cinnamon and serve immediately.

mere-coapte-cu-scortisoara.title: Baked Apples with Cinnamon & Honey
mere-coapte-cu-scortisoara.excerpt: Slow-baked apples stuffed with nuts and honey, lifted by warm cinnamon. A simple, comforting dessert.
steps: Core the apples without piercing through.
Fill with nuts + honey + cinnamon + vanilla.
Top each with a small knob of butter; bake at 180°C for 25–35 min until tender and glossy.

cookies-ciocolata-scortisoara.title: Chocolate Chip & Cinnamon Cookies
cookies-ciocolata-scortisoara.excerpt: Soft cookies with chocolate chips and warm cinnamon notes. Quick to make, gone in a flash!
steps: Beat butter with both sugars until creamy; mix in the egg.
Add dry ingredients, then fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop into balls, place on tray, bake at 180°C for 10–12 min. Cool on a rack.

curry-dovleac-scortisoara.title: Pumpkin Curry with Cinnamon
curry-dovleac-scortisoara.excerpt: Creamy pumpkin, coconut milk and a gentle spice blend where cinnamon shines quietly.
ingredients: Salt, pepper; fresh coriander to serve
steps: Sauté onion in oil for 2–3 min; add garlic, curry and cinnamon for 30 sec.
Add pumpkin, stock and coconut milk; simmer 15–20 min until tender.
Season to taste; serve with rice and coriander.

ceylon.title: Ceylon (“true cinnamon”)
ceylon.excerpt: Delicate, floral, citrusy. Thin quills with many layers. Favoured for refined desserts.

cassia-china.title: Cassia (China)
cassia-china.excerpt: Bold, sweet-spicy aroma. Thick single-scroll sticks. Very popular in baking.
cassia-china.texture: thick, hard sticks; slightly coarse powder

saigon.title: Saigon (Vietnamese)
saigon.excerpt: Highly fragrant with a spicy lift. Instantly boosts dessert flavor.

korintje.title: Korintje (Indonesian)
korintje.excerpt: Balanced, consistent, widely used in commercial baking.

madagascar.title: Madagascar
madagascar.excerpt: Complex aromatic profile with vanilla notes — excellent in custards and crème brûlée.
